task.title: Operating Set Point and Differential Adjustment

context.p: The Operating Set Point is adjustable from 90°F (42°C) to 180°F (82°C). The factory setting is 120°F (49°C). The Differential is adjustable from 2° to 20°. The factory setting is 8°. These user settings are accessed from the Temperatures menu. The following instructions explain how to adjust these settings and navigate the control system menus.

When the water temperature sensed by the control system from the two (upper and lower) Temperature Probes reaches the Operating Set Point the control system ends the heating cycle. A heating cycle is activated again when the sensed water temperature drops below the Operating Set Point minus the Differential setting.
context.note: Lower Differential settings can cause excessive heating cycles (short-cycling), which can cause premature failure of components, such as the Hot Surface Igniter. Set the Differential at the highest setting which produces an acceptable hot water supply. Set the Operating Set Point to the lowest setting which produces an acceptable hot water supply for most efficient use.

step.cmd: From the Desktop screen, press MENU. The "Main Menu" screen will be displayed.
Use the Up and Down slidebar to view all control system menus from the Main Menu.

info.p: The Main Menu is where all control system menus are listed, see Table 20 (page 47) for a complete list and description of control system menus.

step.cmd: Press "Temperatures" to access the Temperature menu.
Press "Operating Setpoint" to access the temperature setpoint menu. Press "CHANGE" to activate the adjustment mode for this menu item.

info.note: Higher Temperature settings increase wear and operating costs. Set the Operating Set Point to the lowest setting which produces an acceptable hot water supply. This will always provide the most energy efficient operation and longer life.

substep.cmd: Use the "+" and "-" Buttons to change the current setting.
Press "ACCEPT" to save the new setting. Press "BACK" to discard changes and return to the previously saved setting.

info.note: Use this procedure to change the Differential setting and other adjustable user settings in the control system menus.
